title: Multi-agent Job Search Assistant
description: I created a multi-agent job search assistant that uses the OpenAI API to help users find jobs, inspired by a workshop I attended at Grace Hopper Conference 2025 led by Apoorva Jaiswal, Anjana Umapathy and Anagha Rumade. It uses a combination of search engines and job boards to find jobs and apply to them. It also uses a combination of search engines and job boards to find jobs and apply to them.

title: Northwestern University's new Women in Computing Website
description: I completely reimagined the WiC website by adding an event tracker with Notion API and a leaderboard that gamifies attendance with a Google Sheets API. Both the frontend and backend are deployed on vercel for seamless updates and the handling of high traffic situations.

title: AI-Powered Platform for Personalized Academic Planning
description: This project reimagines paper.nu with smarter class and major planning. It helps students map out their schedules, track requirements, and avoid conflicts—all with real-time data. With features like smarter course suggestions, community insights, and AI-driven summaries, it makes academic planning easier and more informed. This project uses a Docker container with smart caching and database connection pooling to handle high traffic.

title: Personal Portfolio Website
description: A responsive portfolio website as a creative outlet and to showcase my projects. This project showcases my skills and projects in a clean, modern interface. It features creative ideas intersecting with professionalism.

title: Font Changer for Dyslexia
description: As someone who struggles with dyslexia, I know how frustrating it can be to read dense or cluttered text online. I first discovered the OpenDyslexic font while reading on my Kindle, and it made a huge difference in how easily I could process and enjoy written content. I wanted to bring that same experience to the web, so I created this extension to let myself — and others — read more comfortably on any website. This Chrome extension allows users to change the font of text on any webpage. It includes several font options, including OpenDyslexic, a font designed to improve readability for people with dyslexia.
imageAlt: Font Changer for Dyslexia browser extension

title: CATs Robotics Lab -- Dr Xiao Peng Li of University of Wisconsin-Madison
description: Integrated and programmed the AgileX Ranger, equipping it with a computer and color + depth camera for operational performance analysis to enable path-following functionality and obstacle detection.
imageAlt: CATs Robotics Lab AgileX Ranger robot

title: Instruction Manual
description: Designed and produced a comprehensive Instruction Manual for client JustMate, combining 3D modeling and graphic design to create clear, visually engaging instructions. The manual was tailored to enhance user experience and ensure ease of product assembly and use.

title: Modular Tetris-inspired Shelf for Third Graders
description: International Baccalaureate Design & Technology Coursework. Inspired by the playful geometry of Tetris, I designed and built a modular shelving system tailored for third-grade students. The goal was to create a fun, engaging, and functional storage solution that kids could interact with. Each block-shaped module can be rearranged, allowing for customization and creativity while maintaining practicality in a classroom or bedroom setting. The design process involved user research with children and teachers, concept sketching, CAD modeling, prototyping, and material selection focused on safety and durability.
imageAlt: Modular Tetris-inspired Shelf for Third Graders

title: To do list Tamagotchi pet
description: [In progress] This is a pet that can only be fed by doing a daily task. This little tool is designed to keep you in check! I am still working on it but I have uploaded the draft. You can set a time in settings for the deadline. If you miss a day your pet dies.
imageAlt: To do list tamagotchi pet application
